website_summaries.verdict: A serious handheld vac, but it could be overkill for some needs.
pros: A cordless vacuum with lots of power
The extension hose helps you reach high or tight areas, making this a very convenient option
A three-stage filtration system keeps dust from escaping into the air
Great for cleaning stairs and upholstery
cons: Bigger than the other handheld vac options, but still only 3.2 pounds

customer_reviews.title: Works great, battery lasts long enough to do a few ...
customer_reviews.text: Original post Feb 2015: Works great, battery lasts long enough to do a few large rooms and vacuum couch and chairs. Attachments are a plus. Revised Feb 2017: Exactly 2 years and a couple of days which is just out of warranty, the battery has ceased to charge to an extent where it will work for more than 1 or 2 minutes. I'm removing 3 of my original stars as there is no way to replace the battery easily, there is no service station near me, and Black and Deckers Help Chat doesn't respond. See attached photo of the battery setup. Evidently designed with planned obsolescence!!
customer_reviews.author: theHac

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully
customer_reviews.text: I would give this one 5 stars, but the noise level is obnoxious. I saw this complaint in other reviews, but noise usually isn't a big deal for us. This little machine replaces an older B&D model that we had for probably 5 or 6 years. It has a more powerful motor and battery life lasts long enough to do basic jobs. It picks up dust, pet hair, spider webs - basically whatever. Very satisfied except for the noise. It's not just that the motor is loud in itself, but also the wind passing through the hose (high pitch whistling) is like fingernails on a chalkboard at times. You'll definitely wake up the whole house when you turn it on.
customer_reviews.author: ldvega

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T WORK WORTH A DARN!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is worthless. The on/off switch is extremely hard to do, the charging station is laughable. You have to literally look at the bottom of the unit to try to line it up to charge it. Doesn't hold a charge for very long, the "suction power" is terrible. I bought this to have on our second floor as I have a Shark Pet Hand Held Vacuum on the first floor but was always running back and forth to get it. Thought I would upgrade. WRONG! This was just dropped off at the Goodwill - let someone else deal with it and I bought another Shark.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: One of the worst vacuums ever. Not joking.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum does not do its job. If its job was to make noise like a vacuum, it does that great. If it was to look kind of like a vacuum. It does that. If it was supposed to suck like a vacuum does....DO NOT BUY IT. I am not joking it is horrible. You can hold your hand in front of the vacuum hose and feel almost nothing. I am not sure what everybody else that bought this vacuum is vacuuming up, but must be very very light feathers. Or maybe those white fluff fuzz balls that float around in the spring. It is bad. Don't do it. Especially do not go from a Dyson handheld to this. Horrible.
customer_reviews.author: B Ryan Like the Bird

customer_reviews.title: If you must get a cordless vacuum don't get this one.
customer_reviews.text: If you are in the market for a cordless vacuum that doesn't run for very long and doesn't pick up much when it does run this is exactly what you need. The battery lasts for maybe 15 mins. The suction is not great even right after a full charge. THe tiny little dust bin doesn't cause much of a problem because the thing don't well enough / long enough to pick up enough stuff to fill it up. When you do go to empty the bin, you have to use both hands or twist your wrist into an uncomfortable angle to get dirt and hair out of it.
customer_reviews.author: TX MECH ENGR

customer_reviews.title: Dont believe the other reviews
customer_reviews.text: Low suction, cannot mount other accessories to the boom, vacuum head doesnt lock in place, battery lasts 5-10 minutes. Not worth it unless you need to spot clean a very tiny area. Wont even clean a 1 bedroom apartment in 5 charges.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and not cumbersome.
customer_reviews.text: I am 75 years old and take every opportunity to make housework easier and faster with less stress on my body. I hate doing blinds, but this makes it a lot easier and almost pleasant. When I have to use a little step stool to reach, this light, little unit makes it easier for me. It is a great duster. Only wish the duster attachment was a replaceable accessory, cause I am going to be using this attachment a lot. Only purchased for dusting capabilities, as I have a lot of rougher-textured, homemade wood shelving to reach and older rough-textured faux wood blinds.
customer_reviews.author: Best Buy Research Queen

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum for RV or Vanlife! A little delicate.
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum door broke and had other issues. Black and Decker sent me a replacement no problem. Be gentle with the hinged door when cleaning, it’s plastic. On the plus side, this vacuum is fantastic for full time RV life. It comes with great heads for various situations. The pet hair head is the one I use the most. The head with the brush is perfect for vacuuming dirt from my laptop keyboard! The suction is strong and the battery lasts long enough to do most of your vacuuming. When the battery dies, the unit just shuts off, then you have to recharge. I plug it into my inverter and don’t even think about it.
customer_reviews.author: tiffany-b

customer_reviews.title: Right after the 2 year mark the battery is dead
customer_reviews.text: Right after the 2 year mark the batteries no longer hold charge and it shuts itself off after 5 seconds. Disposable vacuum as the battery pack is not replaceable at all. The power button also jammed due to design flaw some time ago which made it difficult to turn the vacuum on, not like it matters much now. If you want to replace your vacuum every couple of years then this is the one for you! Best to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good Vac STUPID POWER SUPPLY
customer_reviews.text: Why on God's Green Earth did the product manager decide NOT to use the B&D 20-v Max replaceable batteries? This has GOT to be the dumbest decision B&D has made to the best of my extensive knowledge. So some character decided that a built-in battery is better than an array of replaceable ones? So what do you do when you're in the middle of a job and you run out of power? You have to charge the fool thing up again. THAT instead of swapping out the batter for a fresh one. THIS IS FUBAR!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Pelto

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered
customer_reviews.text: It's cute, quaint, love the style. Fur gets caught in very small angle after hose into catching chamber. Can't reach at all and plastic doesn't pop apart to reach. Started off with a lot of power and even when that thing is cleaned out, the power has decreased significantly since purchase. Not enough power to vacuum a car. Pretty big bummer. I've bought better ones out there. I had read these amazon reviews to death before buying, but it's just not enough power to do anything but suck dirt off a laminated surface.
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Sucks, but not the good kind.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have the suction power I was expecting. I have to go over the same area several times in order to get everything. I bought this for my couch and my car, and for the money and voltage, I was expecting more. Also the dirt chamber can be opened too easily (unexpectedly).
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilfong

customer_reviews.title: Performance will diminish over time
customer_reviews.text: This hand vac is a best buy on Consumer Reports, and I do not argue with that rating. Its initial performance was head and shoulders above other models costing much more. The problem comes with extended use. The inner mesh screen inside the debris reservoir can not be removed; and being a screen, it will become clogged over time thus reducing air flow and suction. Taking a stiff brush to it can help a bit, but what is really required is a redesign that will allow the inner screen assembly to be removed for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: IGoPogo

customer_reviews.title: not that great
customer_reviews.text: 1. the stand with the tube holder is not steady enough. 2. the suction is great for the 3-5 minutes, then, it's just average 3. it gets clogged on a regular basis (and I'm not doing heaving cleaning with big debris with it). Results : I would definitely not buy it again. I don't understand how it can get all the praises.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine M. Novak

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT SO MUCH!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this several months ago and have been SOOOO happy with everything about it. The one thing I didn't notice until I noticed the suction wasn't as good as it was in the beginning and that's because you have to push the button on the back of the vacuum and turn the part that holds the dirt to get to another part that holds a lot more dirt. It's just so convenient to vacuum small or big messes and get into areas the big vacuum can't get to. I think I've become a clean freak since I bought it lol.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Franke

customer_reviews.title: Great Vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great vacuum for pet owners. We used a Rainbow once a week and this mostly every day. We have one dog, and three cats. I love this vacuum. I used the pet hair attachment for the loveseat the white cat loves to perch on and the floor attachment for the poorly grouted kitchen tiles every day. I also have to vacuum the bed with it since the 80 lb hairy beast baby deposits a ton of hair on the bed every night. This vacuum is a livesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: The unit itself seems like decent quality but the attachments feel cheap
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum has a lot of suction power and lasts a long time on one charge. The unit itself seems like decent quality but the attachments feel cheap. I haven't tried using the roller head attachment. vacuum is also louder than expected for a small handheld. Also, when emptying, some of the contents seem to go underneath between the base and the container. It's light weight, and I like how the hose on the end is curved; it makes it easier to handle. Overall I'd recommend this product to anyone looking for a decent handheld that is good for small jobs around the house and in the car.
customer_reviews.author: NH Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Like a mini canister vac
customer_reviews.text: The suction is great. Battery lasts long enough for most jobs. Very easy to use and easy to empty the dirt bin. You *can* use it one-handed like a handheld vacuum, but you'll get best results if you hold the bulk in one hand and the hose end in the other hand. Dirt bin does fill up quickly. It's a handheld vacuum, so they can't really give it a big space to hold dirt. This thing is also LOUD. If you use this vac in an enclosed space, you will want hearing protection (cheap earplugs work fine). This is why I docked a star from my review. Overall a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Barry S

customer_reviews.title: Gets clogged way to easily
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous version of this and loved it. But the motor quit on me after a year or so. I was dissapointed when I couldn't find the same one, but purchased the updated version. This one is junk compared to the old one. It gets clogged way too easily and is harder to unclog. The airflow is far worse and it barely picks anything up. I wind up pulling out my large vacuum for small jobs because this one is so useless. I will be looking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: TeddyL

customer_reviews.title: Does its job and is lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This is the best little hand-held vacuum we've ever had. It's lightweight, it cleans up furniture and small areas of the floor very easily. It also worked very well with dust balls under a bed.
customer_reviews.author: Jay-man

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much useless
customer_reviews.text: The only reason to buy this is the floor attachment. With that in use, it overheats and shuts off in less than 20 seconds almost every time, even with a brand new filter. it might work well for the other attachments, but you can easily find other hand-held vacuums that work equally well for less than half the price. If you're buying this for the floor attachment, don't waste your money or time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really liked this vacuum, but... (Updated)
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this vacuum, but it broke after a little more than a year. The motor started making an occasional noise that developed into a constant noise with an odor and then it just died. UPDATE: After I posted this review, B&D sent me a replacement free of charge. They did not ask me to change my review or take any other action in return. Because of this very good customer service, I'm adding a star back on.
customer_reviews.author: J. Power

customer_reviews.title: Great for small camps and cars
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to bring to an off grid camp. For this purpose, it's been perfect. It has enough energy to run for about an hour. This lets me suck up dead flies, mouse poop, and cobwebs. I haven't use the extension tube, favoring to hold the floor sweeper on the end of the hose. This works "just OK" but I didn't expect much from the floor sweeper anyway. It's fine for car clean up and picking up pubes in the bathroom. It will never replace a real vacuum, but if you have pretty modest expectations and a need for a rechargeable vacuum, this will do well enough.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Black and Decker BDH2020FL hand vacuum in June 2017. While it has decent cleaning power (for a third of the cost of the Dyson cordless hand vacuum), the lithium battery lost more than 2/3rds of its total battery life. Unfortunately, the battery is built into the main vacuum housing and (apparently) no relacement battery exists. Going with a corded hand vacuum; this vacuum was a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my 92 YO handicap mom, what a great product.
customer_reviews.text: As stated in the headline I bought this for my handicap mother who insists on doing here own vacuuming. This is the 4th vacuum I bought her. Bought a Dyson to heavy, Shark and an off brad. All were to had to plug in the unit to charge or to heavy. This unit has great suction, a good assortment of tools and does not have to be plugged in. To charge you just set it on the base, it has two tabs the transfers the power for the battery. It has a short hose and my mom sets it on here wheelchair foot rest and does her entire apartment. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn A.

customer_reviews.title: Good ergonomics, battery sucks
customer_reviews.text: I liked this while it lasted, for car vacuuming, but unfortunately the battery dies and it only runs for a minute (maybe even less?) and it's right at 3 years old. I might have gotten only 50 vacuuming sessions out of it in total over those 3 years? What a waste. I bought a lithium vacuum so it would last. The ergonomics of this vacuum with the hose and handle I love. Also, emptying the canister is always a bit messy, and leaves residue all over the unit that you have to then go clean with a wet cloth to get rid of.
customer_reviews.author: Xantor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent producgt
customer_reviews.text: Have given these as gifts to two of our adult children that have pets. The units work very well, have survived young children, and do the job efficiently. There have been no issues with durability or heavy use. Both units are used more than once daily and have been for months. Really an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: drbobstl

customer_reviews.title: Weak. Don't buy, even when on sale
customer_reviews.text: The look and feel is nice and it's compact. But the suction is very weak. I bought this as a vacuum to handle a few small rugs and couches in my small, hardwood floor apartment. It doesn't quite do the trick. It's not powerful enough to pick up everything on the rugs, with or without the extension tool which only seems to make it even weaker. Not bad for a quick vacuum between couch cushions but it's not strong enough to handle much more than that. I'm sure there are better cordless vacuums in this price range
customer_reviews.author: Jerems

customer_reviews.title: This is a great vacuum for the first 6 months and then....
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is OK. I gave it 3 stars because it has lost its suction and I've only had it for 10 months. It worked great for the first 6 months and loved that you could open the front to dump out the dirt. But as I used it more for light duty cleaning, it kept losing more and more of its suction. Which is a bummer because I love that its light weight and I can use it on the stairs. I have to say that I was disappointed. Its too late to return now.
customer_reviews.author: E. G.

customer_reviews.title: Awkward Design
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm a fan of Dustbusters, and have owned -- and used till they died -- a whole range of models. I'm surprised this one is still available. Some buyers have had good experiences with it; I have not. The design is extremely awkward to handle. I've used the floor attachment and wand exactly once for that reason. Suction is OK. I've kept it as a spare, to use as a handvac on the floor of a seldom-used bathroom. I will say that it's easier than some to empty and clean out.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca H. Lowndes

customer_reviews.title: SO HANDY
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for 4 months and use it ALL THE TIME. This is a product that works beautifully. We use it everywhere. Window sills, cabinet tops, cracks and crevices, top of curtains and drapes, top of appliances, wood blinds, under sofa and chair cushions, in front of fireplace and handy after you vacumned the carpets with the regular larger vacuum but see a few small crumbs in a small area. Have never ran the charge down and just recharges when you set it back on the cradle charger. Wouldnt want to be without this powerful little machine.
customer_reviews.author: RDB

customer_reviews.title: This little guy is perfect for spot vacuuming
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is perfect for spot vacuuming. It is surprisingly powerful for its size, and a breeze to empty and charge. My home is way cleaner now that I can just grab it and go. I can get about an hour of spot vacuuming off one charge. What's extra nice is that you don't lose suction towards the end of battery life, it just shuts off.
customer_reviews.author: K. Egan

customer_reviews.title: Motor burnt out. No replacement.
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: After calling customer service (they didn't respond to my latest email) and explaining the situation, the representative agreed to replace the product. Thank you! You gotta treat your customers properly--there're a million brands and products that do the same thing. ORIGINAL REVIEW (1 star) An absolute terrible appliance. I had this to vacuum out my car once per month. Very light use. The motor died and Black and Decker refused to replace it because it was out of warranty. If you want a disposable handheld vacuum with poor customer service...
customer_reviews.author: John Banks

customer_reviews.title: It may be a fine product in other respects
customer_reviews.text: Whatever virtues or other shortcomings this widely well-reviewed vacuum may have, its motor noise is not just extremely loud but high-pitched as well, making it unusable for us. It may be a fine product in other respects, but after one brief power-on trial we returned it without even exploring its capabilities. It may be the case that this is a problem with all handheld vacs — I don't know. But if this is is an issue for you, be warned.
customer_reviews.author: LordHudsonStreet

customer_reviews.title: ... this vacuum for four months and so far I love it. I've owned several other car vacs and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this vacuum for four months and so far I love it. I've owned several other car vacs and so far it's the best one I've had. I'm a clean freak and use it a lot and it works great. Reaches down the side of the seats beautifully and I have yet to run down the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Must be perfectly clean or it loses all suction
customer_reviews.text: Unless the filter is perfectly clean, this has all the suction power of gentle breeze. And the filter will not stay clean through more than a few uses. But, regardless of suction power, it sounds like an airplane taking off. Hearing loss AND no cleaning power! Save your money and buy a Dyson—I wish we had.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Suction Not Good
customer_reviews.text: I liked the size and weight of this vacuum, but the suction is terrible!! In the middle of vacuuming crumbs from the floor, I turned the hose upside down and the crumbs fell out while the vacuum was on. I checked for any blockage in the line and there wasn't one. I have always loved Black & Decker, but this product fell short on their other vacuums I have owned. I will need to return this product and find one that works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Texas specks are no match, but don't even try Texas cockroaches
customer_reviews.text: Got this on a blowout deal, so it's easily a 5. I live in Texas and I have these stupid black "specks" that come in my house with their sole purpose of dying. (I first thought they were feces, but I've seen them fidgeting to death.) This little wonder is great for them, spilled coffee grounds, paper punches, cobwebs and the tiny spiders trying to flee. It's great for baseboards, between the staircase spindles, in the seams of door thresholds and anywhere and why else you'd need to pull out and plug in a vacuum. Don't expect huge suction, but it's handy for what it can do.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Majestyk

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum but not durable
customer_reviews.text: First I have generally loved this little vacuum. The charge lasts a long time and it does a good job spot cleaning around the house. Unfortunately, I bought it less than six months ago and one of the accessories has already broken. It is one of the tubes and no longer will snap into the other piece, making the rest of the accessories useless. Now I'm stuck trying to find just the accessories or an entirely new vacuum
customer_reviews.author: jk

customer_reviews.title: Adequate, but not more.
customer_reviews.text: The BLACK+DECKER BDH2020FL 20V Max Lithium Flex Vacuum is adequate, but not more than that. The best feature of this vacuum is its flexible hose, which makes it easier to get into areas the typical hand-held vac may not be able to. The negatives are: this vac is much louder than others I have used and the suction is only mediocre. In addition, the on/off slide switch on the vac I received in VERY difficult to slide, especially going from the off to the on position.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Engineering Failure
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum lost about 50% of its suction power after only a couple of months. We use it maybe 3 or 4 times a week and at this point (after about 7 months) it will not even pick up bread crumbs when it is fully charged. The whole design is very awkward. The curve of the hose attachment makes it hard to get into small spaces and when the hose is extended you need two hands to vacuum. The long attachment became completely useless after about 6 weeks because the vacuum had not enough suction power to pick up anything. I have had hand vacuums for a third of the price that worked way better!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Barkemeyer

customer_reviews.title: Black and Decker 20 volt
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this vacuum. It is SOOOOO much easier than hauling my big vacuum all over the house. I have a bed that is too low to vacuum with my big vacuum. This vacuum has a long accessory that makes it so easy to get under furniture. And, I got it on sale and that made me so happy too. I have 2 German Shepherds and they shed all of the time (it seems) and one long-haired cat. The pet accessory is a real help. Definitely a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: rileybug

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The suction is AWFUL. Do not waste your money. I was hopeful as many people recommended this. I could barely get it to suck up a little dirt in my car. I bought it because it was supposed to be a great cordless option but I’ll just use my regular corded vacuum if I have to sacrifice suction
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until Battery Didn't Hold Charge
customer_reviews.text: Here's the deal. I really liked the concept and how it functioned when I got it, but now the battery dies in less than 5 minutes. I have had the unit for 2 years. They do not tell you that the vacuum is only good for 24 months. The unit sits on the charger base. It seems simple enough. So frustrating that after 2 years I am looking for another brand that will last longer. I only use the vacuum once a week. Is it possible that my unit is defective? NO idea but I was happy with it when I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn B

customer_reviews.title: One year later, it only works in short bursts
customer_reviews.text: A battery issue (I'm assuming) has rendered this vacuum frustrating, to say the least. The hinge of the dust release door broke fairly quickly and is now held on by tape. The suction is still fairly good but the vacuum only runs for ever-decreasing bursts of time, starting at 45 seconds (fully charged) eventually only running for a few seconds at a time (two minutes later) before giving up entirely. I wish this vacuum still worked as well as it did at first, but it's become a frustrating appliance one must go to battle with to use in any helpful way. Steer clear, as this vacuum sucks — or rather, it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Sjogren

customer_reviews.title: ".... meh" - though recommended over Dyson's offering
customer_reviews.text: This is/was wirecutter's recommendation for cordless vacuums but it's pretty anemic. Doesn't easily align with charging base - there is a light to indicate when vacuum and base are aligned properly but would be nice to have some alternate tactile/haptic feedback. Ours sits on floor in orientation that makes it hard to see charging light to confirm that it is charging. It's just OK - maybe would buy again if on sale at substantial discount. Own Dyson cordless which has much stronger suction but it's overpriced. Forced to choose, I'd have to pick the Black & Decker - value to cost for Dyson is less than this one.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great hand held vacuum, but ...
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum works great, except I have two problems. 1) The battery goes only for 20 minutes, which really isn’t enough. 2) I just found out Black & Decker is a top contributor to Trump. Now, that may be good for you. It may not matter to you. So, this is probably a good purchase for you. But, for those who don’t want to support Trump, you may want to consider buying a different product. I’m sure there’s others which are as good.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I've had this vacuum for more than a year now. At first it worked great, but it slowly has lost suction, and now pretty much won't suck up anything. You might be thinking, "He just didn't clean the filter often enough or abused it" -> You would be wrong, I cleaned it after every use and only used it for light household cleaning. There is no reason the vacuum should have lost power. This thing is garbage, don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Buckland

customer_reviews.title: Tiny little thing actually works
customer_reviews.text: This was a Wirecutter recommended product. I wanted a hand-held vac for the car and various nooks and crannies in the house that the floor vac wouldn't do. I'm amazed at how small it is, but today it made short work of cleaning up the crap on the floor of my car. Radically less hassle than pulling out the corded vac. Okay. Everyone on my Christmas list is getting one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Carson

customer_reviews.title: Terrific handheld--great size and power
customer_reviews.text: This little vac is the best handheld I have ever used. Lots of power and really versatile. No trouble charging or using it at all. Thought the extra attachments were likely not used but it has enough power you can certainly use them and it makes it a great little go to for quick clean ups and chasing dust as those of us with a bit of OCD tend to do. Good buy and worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Good when it worked, but switch failing after 2-1/2 years
customer_reviews.text: I liked this little vacuum a lot for quick cleanups. However, after about 2-1/2 years of use, the switch mechanism is failing... either too hard to push and engage, or pops off by itself, or (worse) can sometimes stay stuck in the on position. I presume some plastic fatigue is causing it to easily get hung up, though when I took it apart I could see nothing obvious.
customer_reviews.author: cmajor9th

customer_reviews.title: I'm addicted
customer_reviews.text: This little machine deserves to get my very first review on Amazon. The whole family loves it, we constantly use it for stairs, little spills, in the car etc. I was worried that the batteries will give in within a year or two which would be upsetting since they are not replaceable. But for now it works fine and the charge is long enough to vacuum the car or a larger carpet. I don't love the design of the home base and how all the different attachments don't really have anywhere to go but overall this is my new best friend.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea C Seyboth

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy and Powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Love this little vacuum. I use it around the house for random things. The battery lasts a good while and it picks up everything we have put it up against. This is not a shop van but it definitely helps around the house for pet hair and household clean up. I would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price + functionality
customer_reviews.text: This may seem a little pricey but what are you comparing it to? A shopvac-type unit costs about half but it requires bending down to the floor. It also has a limited dirt collection reservoir and, most importantly, the suction power of this vacuum is much greater. Comparing to a traditional vacuum? This costs half or one third. Suction isn’t as great but it’s a heck of a lot easier to maneuver. This is great for small apartments, maybe dorm rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah X

customer_reviews.title: Good for intended use. Good for small cleanups, etc., but VERY loud.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to clean upholstery, small messes in hard to access, spots. Pros: (1) Powerful for its size; (2) Can be sued with hose in fixed position or loose. (2) With hose loose, can get in small spaces; (3) Fairly easy to empty and clean filter. Cons: (1) VERY loud Overall serves its purpose quite well. Haven't use the attachments (Wand, floor attachment, etc.) so can't comment on these.
customer_reviews.author: LCB

customer_reviews.title: Small design flaw but overall great
customer_reviews.text: After a very frustrating start, I really like this vacuum. It is great on my cat hair. The attachments are nice HOWEVER the locking ring does not release per instructions. You are supposed to be able to turn the pieces so that the locking clips will release so that you can affix your attachments. Does not work! You need to take a small screwdriver and poke the clips through the hole so that they release. They reattach fine but they release mechanism simply does not work as advertised. Other than that, I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: diane ryan

customer_reviews.title: No power cord, super lightweight, good suction
customer_reviews.text: Awesome awesome awesome!! I love this handy little thing! Perfect for older people who can’t lug around a bulky vacuum. Also perfect for the kids to use. It’s extremely light weight, not an awkward grip, no power cords, the pieces are all so very light. This is the coolest little vacuum. And bonus- my 4 year old son loves to use this because he acts like it’s a ghost busters ghost trap. He vacuums for us when it’s time. We all love it!
customer_reviews.author: amandaamanda

customer_reviews.title: What a great little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: What a great little vacuum! Comes with a couple attachments that are perfect. The pet hair attachment is The Best! I have a long hair cat and this thing works great to remove fur from the furniture & carpeted stairs, and clean up around the litter box!! Flexible at reaching everything yet stores away compact. Great at cleaning out the car too! Only complaint is emptying the canister, it gets a bit on the base of the vacuum every time. Great at cleaning and filtering though. Love that it’s a cleanable/reusable filter.
customer_reviews.author: M Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Favorite little vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little vacuum! It's surprisingly powerful. After reading all of the negative reviews I was a little apprehensive, but I'm so glad I got it. I use it for the minivan (kids + snacks = crumbs galore). The pet attachment works well for our sofa too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... have been using this Vacuum for 3 weeks and LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this Vacuum for 3 weeks and LOVE it!! It is super light and the attachments work great. Some people complained about how loud it was and I really don't understand what they are talking about. It is a vacuum and it makes noise! It is not to loud though. It is excellent for cleaning my car and little messes in the house. I have cats and the pet tool works fabulous. The battery lasts just long enough for what you will need it for. I read lots of reviews on other vacuums before I bought this one and am so glad I chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sandralina

customer_reviews.title: Super clean!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement for a Dustbuster that shrieks when turned on. The difference in the cleaning power is AMAZING. It picks up so much more pet hair and dirt than the Dustbuster, I am almost embarrassed! I could not believe the crud in the filter and the giant blob of dog hair. It is a bit louder than I would like it, but that's a small price to pay for the cleaning power. Charges fast, I like the blue light that signals that it is charging and it is properly sitting on the base.
customer_reviews.author: Candy Van Brunt

customer_reviews.title: Totally happy with this! Fits my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be a really useful little vacuum. I was concerned about it having so many negative reviews but I am totally happy with it. It vacuums well, the attachments are easy to change out, the flexible hose is a huge benefit. I've had it for several months and use it several times a week. It is a little noisy, but I expected that. After all it is a vacuum cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: I'm excited about a vacuum?
customer_reviews.text: It sucks great. It's super portable. My kid even likes vacuuming with it, so he's cleaning up his own messes now. You can dump it out easily, and cleaning the filter is simple with great access. It sits in a little base to charge that also holds its accessories. The hose is what really makes this better than a smaller vacuum: it can get anywhere and is easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: craig in texas

customer_reviews.title: It’s mostly awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is great! It’s so easy to use, holds up a charge pretty well, and the suction is great! I wanted a car vacuum and something for all of my hair that floats off in the bathroom. I did not expect it to work so well! My only small complaint is that emptying it is a little weird because you have to tip the whole thing on its side.. but honestly that’s not that bad
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Price

customer_reviews.title: Needs to go back to the Drawing Board
customer_reviews.text: Too expensive for the terrible design. It does pick up well but adding the floor head is a joke unless your picking up cheerios. Charging station is a joke as it does not lock in place and gives no potion to hang inside a closet. They had a good idea but fell short in the accessories storage and charging dock.
customer_reviews.author: Davy Jones

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Barely any suction. I was relying on review where someone said it was better than dyson. Must have been one of those fake reviews I read about on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Chey

customer_reviews.title: Nice little vaccum
customer_reviews.text: I really like this vacuum, it's small, lightweight and works well as long as you don't use the floor attachment or expect to vaccum for more than 15 minutes at a time. It loses suction drastically with the floor attachment. The suction is powerful with the any other accessory, I wish the battery would last longer too.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha A. Hedspeth

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, light and versatile. Also easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little vacuum cleaner, I did not realize how much I would enjoy using it with the extended hose. You can place the vacuum unit on the stairs while you take the time to clean a step and then simply move up to the next step. It really makes it light and flexible and I would say this would make it great for anyone looking for something powerful, easy to use which will not strain your arm while cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S

customer_reviews.title: Small footprint and works great
customer_reviews.text: I love that you can plug it in anywhere and that it fits so nice in an unused corner. It comes in so handy in the kitchen, but I do use it everywhere. It is sooooo much easier than dragging out the large vac with all the attachments when you just have a few things to scoop up, or a small space to clean. Liked the first one I bought for my summer home so much that I immediately bought one for my winter home too!
customer_reviews.author: Irene Rose

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing performance from this highly rated product. Maybe I got a dud, but I charged it up overnight and attempted to vacuum out my SUV the next day. The suction is so poor it couldn't even retrieve tiny scraps of paper from the bottom of a cupholder. It is also so loud it sounds like a jet taking off. I could forgive the noise it it actually functioned as advertised. But it doesn't, so back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Hose makes it easy to reach difficult areas. Powerful. Multiple uses.
customer_reviews.text: Hose makes it easy to reach difficult areas. Also means you don’t need to lift entire machine. Suction very strong. Expensive but more useful than cheaper ones. So far so good with battery. Have had problems with battery dying with some other brands. After using for a while I found filter must be cleaned often. Suction weakens if filter dirty. Not a problem, instructions easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: A. K

customer_reviews.title: Battery didn’t last after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved how small and convenient this vacuum was. I brought it out everyday for a quick run over my wood floors. It did a decent job with the dog hair and dust. But after 4 months the battery life was less than half and now at 5 months it barely lasts more than 1 minute. I wish I could return it but I’m sure it is too late at this point. I wouldn’t recommended it.
customer_reviews.author: Cristy

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little vac!! Suction is great and it’s just so light you can use it anywhere. Plus the noise level is such that it doesn’t scare my 10 month old pup! He does think the little hose crevice attachment is a toy though! 😉 Best purchase on Amazon!! Worth every penny. And I got it on sale too but would have paid full price.
customer_reviews.author: Jules03

customer_reviews.title: An excellent small hand-held vac.
customer_reviews.text: Seems quite powerful, and I love the versatility of the attachments (although i wish they could attach to the power base to keep them handy). Very easy to empty the vac after using each time. VERY handy in keeping my white carpet clean without having to pull out my full-sized machine. Easy to use to pick up small messes even on the tabletop/nightstand, along baseboards. etc. Will likely buy another for my sister! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: patricianyc

customer_reviews.title: Great for small to medium vacuuming jobs.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my camper. It works great and has amazingly strong suction for a cordless device. I was especially surprised at how well the floor tool worked. I gave it four stars instead of five because it is a pain to clean the filter. You need an air compressor to do a thorough cleaning. That said, I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: One of the best.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the greatest little vacuums I've had. I go through a LOT of vacuums and admit to being obsessive with my need for finding the best. This is one of my two favorites now. I didn't care for the way it sits on the charger because I find I've missed the actual position at times, but that takes just a minute extra to be sure I have it sitting correctly and then be sure it isn't moved during the charge. The floor accessory is especially nice! Run time on one charge is about the longest I've seen on a handheld!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma B

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Bought it because I needed it for pet hair removal. Please do not buy as it is useless when it comes to vacuuming up cat hair! Do not waste your money. Was out of town for 2 wks and did not use it till later on and by that time the return window had elapsed. 100$ wasted on a product that was touted as great pet hair removal.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Arnold-Reyes

customer_reviews.title: From what it has done on the inside rugs I expect it to do a great job in my car
customer_reviews.text: I just had a stick vacuum for my small apartment but it can't get to some hard-to-reach places such as under a bed and in corners, so those places were collecting thick dust. The B&D 2020 has no trouble sucking these up and the battery is still strong when I'm done. I haven't used it longer than about 10 minutes so don't know how it does for longer periods. Also haven't used it on larger whole rugs but will try it. From what it has done on the inside rugs I expect it to do a great job in my car. Will update if this is a problem but will be very surprised if so. Great hand vac.
customer_reviews.author: pegasus

customer_reviews.title: Great for suction - small cordless
customer_reviews.text: Being a small cordless vacuum for quick pickups it’s outstanding. I use it in my home to pick up just about anything and the suction is great. Love the attachments. Use it to clean my car too. This is my 3rd one, tried others but they don’t have the great suction and ease of recharging it. Have 3, one in upstairs, one downstairs and one in garage. Love em! Would definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: De Grey

customer_reviews.title: Great Hand Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new one as our older Black and Decker one from years ago was wearing out. Really like this as it is perfect size for cleaning dryer lint screen in laundry room as well as around window sills etc. Like the feature of a charging base. Just what we needed as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: VRaney

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money for hardwood
customer_reviews.text: This product is everything I could’ve asked for to clean the hair off of the hardwood. It’s lightweight and easy. The couch hair doesn’t come up easy but if you have a lot of time, it will work. My only complaint is the attachment to sweep the floor. The wheels on it wrap hair around it and then don’t work .
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Did not disappoint!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for two reasons: 1. Consumer Reports ranks it as one of the best for animal hair and 2. I needed a vacuum that could pick up dog hair from many different surfaces. It it amazing! We had our dogs at a VBO and brought their blankets to keep hair off of furniture. Of course it didn't work completely and there was hair on the couch that I typically can't get off using a 'pet roller' with tape. The vacuum had no problem with it! It is lightweight and very easy to use. I HIGHLY suggest this product, especially if you have pets!!
customer_reviews.author: Denise R Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: good compact little vacuum helps me with cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I love using this on my steps and in corners where my big floor vacuum can't reach. Also used under the kitchen cabinets. It is strong enough for my use, like dust, spider webs, crumbs, etc. I don't have any pets. I bought it to use in my RV but love it in my house too!! I haven't emptied it yet, but I can see through the clear plastic what needs emptied. It charged up with no problem. I probably won't be using the floor attachment tool. Shipped safely, no damage.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Lady

customer_reviews.title: Sucks...Yes this little bad boy does suck and very well... Light weight and holds a charge.
customer_reviews.text: This little unit really SUCKS. I had to say that, sorry. But it does have great suction and is very light weight. Holds a charge very well and has all the proper attachments. Nothing much else to say but "I would purchase again." Great for steps and other small messes where you don't want to drag out your big machine. Very easy to clean as well. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: Good for certain usage
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this long enough to judge much; so far items such as suction and battery life seem good. But I will mention to only buy this if you intend to use the hose regularly. Compared to a more standard hand vac, this is heavier, shorter (with the hose coiled up) so you have to bend over further, and cleaning out the filter more complicated.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: best small vacuum ever!
customer_reviews.text: this is the best vacuum (small but powerful!) I;'ve ever had. I have a Miele and it's very good, but too heavy. I needed something to use in the car or to avoid to plug in because I couldn't reach the spot. This is simply fantastic! The suction power is great, it's light and the battery life lasts long. It's also very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Rosanna

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Hand Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum picks up everything we have called on it to do. The charging stand and Lion battery ensure its ready to go when needed. It is noisier that the ancient Dustbuster it replaced. We don't have pets or stairs, so can't judge performance in those dimensions
customer_reviews.author: RZ

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! This vacuum has significantly more power than the previous versions. Using the charging base ensures the unit is charged 100% every time you use it. Not a day goes by that I don't use this little vacuum everywhere! The design allows you to into places that a normal/typical handheld vacuum could never even touch.
customer_reviews.author: Les Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Really convenient for small jobs. Good suction for size.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful suction for size. So convenient for small jobs. My daughter purchased this after doing research and I liked it so much I bought one too. Tom liked it so much after I brought it to our country place so he could clean up spider webs and other small jobs I now have to buy another one for the main house. Best of the small cordless vacuums I’ve bought.
customer_reviews.author: cyssf

customer_reviews.title: Hashtag - Quality Life Hack item!
customer_reviews.text: I work at a water treatment plant that has an Operations Building with a yearly gnat infestation that begins in late Spring to early Summer as the temperature rises. They end up on every surface and the easiest way to clean-up, in my humble opinion, is to use this BLACK+DECKER 20V MAX Flex Handheld Vacuum portable vacuum. It has excellent suction and a dust bowl compartment door that opens easily for quick emptying between uses. I also appreciate the fact that the filters are washable. - a little Simple Green and water is all you need to maintain maximum suction. Hashtag - Quality Life Hack item!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Richards

customer_reviews.title: Light -- you can carry wherever you need -- YET POWERFUL!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little vaccum! Grains of kitty litter and dust on my wooden floors vacuum up just fine. Area rugs, carpets and even shelves under the sink get cleaned. Small plate vacuum rests on for charging has metal that matches metal on vacuum, the two must touch -- a blue light blinks while charging. Mine seems to lose its charge if unplugged for couple days so I always plug it in before using to give full charge. Easy to clean--easy to use. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: blueberries

customer_reviews.title: Trash the dust buster, This is the one to own!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy has great suction. the basic tools that are INCLUDED are just right to get most jobs done. The battery life has been great (of course it’s new), Vacuumed 2 SUVs and it was still running strong. Bought it to replace a Dust Buster in the kitchen but I am using it all over the house and on stairs. It’s a bit more expensive than some others but well worth it. WELL DONE B&D
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing amount of suction power.
customer_reviews.text: I was not happy with this at all and did return it. The ease of cordless wasn't worth the lack of suction power. Also, what is not shown in any of the pictures is that there is no storage option provided for the floor attachment. If you sit the main unit on a counter (as the ad does) then you have to find a closet or something to stick the floor attachment in.
customer_reviews.author: Lurah

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic sucking solution!
customer_reviews.text: This thing does exactly what it says it will. Don't expect a ridiculous amount of suction, but I've found that it has more than enough to handle most jobs. I have a 40 pound Siberian Husky, and she sheds enough hair to make pillows out of in a week. This vacuum has no trouble dealing with the demand, and the pet hair attatchment works great for removing hair from couches and even clothes! Overall, I'd say this is a fantastic product that is priced fairly and works as described.
customer_reviews.author: Tai Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great size and quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing! It's super lightweight and small, so it's easy to carry and store. You do have to carry it around, which I can see some people potentially not liking. But it's so light, that hasn't bothered me personally. The floor attachment is pretty good for what it is. It could probably pick up more a little better, but it's gentle on the hardwood floors and still does a decent job. I use the crevice tool the most, and that thing is a good size and very powerful. I have a relatively small apartment, so I was looking for something that didn't take up a lot of storage space. This is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: and I can get into the hard-to-reach corners easily. Love it
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum cleaner is a life saver. I have 3 cats, and when I sweep the floor, tufts of hair always fly away. This vacuum picks up all the hair that gets away, and I can get into the hard-to-reach corners easily. Love it! I definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect dorm room vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the dorm room, vacuuming the car, or removing pet hair. We've used it for all of these purposes. Our college student keeps his car cleaner, now that he doesn't have to deal with cords. Powerful enough with the pet hair attachment to clean the most stubborn pet hair (even though it does not have any rotating brushes).
customer_reviews.author: Hardcore shopper

customer_reviews.title: Mommys new BFF
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is top notch! For how small it is, it's amazingly strong. It does a great job of picking up sand and hair off of hardwood and ceramic floors so that bare feet can happily walk without gross grit sticking. This thing even picked up my husbands thick short hair when he gave himeself a hair not! I love the attachment that come with it and seriously have used this almost everyday since I got it charged up.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Very Dissappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited for this product. Well as excited you can get for a cordless vacuum. Having a small apartment I thought this was a great solution. Today - after multiple failed calls to Amazon and Black and Decker In hope of returning or exchanging - I am throwing out the vacuum. The auction was never very strong. But it got worse and worse. Barely able to pick up pieces of dirt let alone a grain of fallen of rice on the floor. I would feel guilty to even donate this vacuum. Very disappointed and will not be purchasing another Black and Decker item.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: On-off switch didn't work. Also, general construction appears flimsy; charger looks as if it was made for a cheap toy. SENT BACK. Bought a DeWalt.
customer_reviews.author: Thunderturkey

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER 20V Max Flex Handheld Vacuum with Pet Hair Brush, Cordless, Grey (BDH2020FL)
product_meta.description: Style Name:Vacuum OnlyThe BLACK+DECKER BDH2020FL 20V max lithium Flex vac with pet hair brush features lithium technology for strong suction and fade free power. Packed with strong suction and fade free power. It also includes a pet hair brush to remove stubborn pet hair. It has a flexible 4 foot hose to reaches dirt high and low and this cordless, portable and ultra compact vac allows you to tackle your chores without lugging out your full size vacuum . A high performance motor delivers strong suction for messes big and small and the quick charging base keeps Flex vac charged and accessories organized. Cyclonic action spins dirt away from the filter to help maintain performance and a 3 stage filtration system prevents dust and debris from escaping. It also has an easy to empty, washable bowl and filter for thorough cleaning. Includes: Flex vac, pet hair brush, 2 in 1 nozzle/brush tool, long crevice tool, charging base, washable filter (model PVF110).
feature_bullets: Dustbowl capacity 20.6 ounces; Strong suction & fade free power; Suction Power: 24 AW
Pet hair brush easily removes stubborn pet hair
Easy to empty, washable bowl and filter for thorough cleaning
3 stage filtration system prevents dust and debris from escaping

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,725 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
